text.*:
The Emanuel Miller Memorial Lectures commemorate the British child psychiatrist Emanuel Miller (1892–1970). They began in 1972.[1]

List[edit]

This list is incomplete; you can help by expanding it.
  • 1972 Meyer Fortes, The First-born[2][3]
  • 1973 Jack Tizard, The Upbringing of Other People's Children: Implications of Research and for Research[4]
  • 1974 Leon Eisenberg, The Ethics of Intervention: Acting amidst Ambiguity[5]
  • 1975 Robert A. Hinde, On Describing Relationships[6]
  • 1976 Eric Midwinter, The Professional-Lay Relationship: A Victorian Legacy[7]
  • 1981 Michael Rutter, Stress, Coping and Development: Some Issues and Some Questions[8]
  • 1982 (9th) Jerome Kagan, The Emergence of Self[9]
  • 1987 P. H. Venables, Childhood markers for adult disorders[10]
  • 1990 Neville Bennett, Cooperative Learning in Classrooms: Processes and Outcomes[11]
  • 1991 Christopher Gillberg, Autism and autistic-like conditions[12]
  • 1992 Peter Fonagy, The theory and practice of resilience[13]
  • 1993 Robert Plomin, Genetic research and identification of environmental influences[14]
  • 1994 M. Kovacs, Depressive disorders in childhood: an impressionistic landscape[15]
  • 1995 J. Dunn, Children's relationships: bridging the divide between cognitive and social development[16]
  • 1996 M. Main, Current Issues in Attachment[17]
  • 1997 M. Sigman, Change and continuity in the development of children with autism.[18]
  • 1998 Michael Rutter, Autism: Two-way interplay between research and clinical work[19]
  • 2000 William Yule, From Pogroms to "Ethnic Cleansing": Meeting the Needs of War Affected Children[20]
  • 2001 Jay Belsky, Developmental Risks (Still) Associated with Early Child Care[21]
  • 2004 Uta Frith, Confusions and controversies about Asperger syndrome[22]
  • 2006 Femmie Juffer, Adoption as intervention[23]
  • 2008 Ian M. Goodyer, Early onset depressions – meanings, mechanisms and processes[24]
  • 2009 Michael Rutter, Attachment insecurity, disinhibited attachment, and attachment disorders: where do research findings leave the concepts?[25]
  • 2012 D. V. M. Bishop, Neuroscientific studies of intervention for language impairment in children: interpretive and methodological problems[26]
  • 2018 announcement, Sir Robin Murray[27]

Notes[edit]

  1. ^ Goody, Jack (1975-10-02). The Character of Kinship. Cambridge University Press. p. x. ISBN 9780521290029. Retrieved 4 October 2017. 
  2. ^ Goody, Jack (1975-10-02). The Character of Kinship. Cambridge University Press. p. x. ISBN 9780521290029. Retrieved 28 July 2017. 
  3. ^ Fortes, Meyer (1974). "The First Born". Journal of Child Psychology and Psychiatry. 15 (2): 81–104. doi:10.1111/j.1469-7610.1974.tb01228.x. ISSN 0021-9630. 
  4. ^ Tizard, Jack (1974). "The Upbringing of Other People's Children: Implications of Research and for Research". Journal of Child Psychology and Psychiatry. 15 (3): 161–173. doi:10.1111/j.1469-7610.1974.tb01242.x. ISSN 0021-9630. 
  5. ^ Eisenberg, Leon (1975). "The Ethics of Intervention: Acting amidst Ambiguity". Journal of Child Psychology and Psychiatry. 16 (2): 93–104. doi:10.1111/j.1469-7610.1975.tb01260.x. ISSN 0021-9630. 
  6. ^ Hinde, Robert A. (1976). "On Describing Relationships". Journal of Child Psychology and Psychiatry. 17 (1): 1–19. doi:10.1111/j.1469-7610.1976.tb00370.x. ISSN 0021-9630. 
  7. ^ Midwinter, Eric (1977). "The Professional-Lay Relationship: A Victorian Legacy". Journal of Child Psychology and Psychiatry. 18 (2): 101–113. doi:10.1111/j.1469-7610.1977.tb00423.x. ISSN 0021-9630. 
  8. ^ Rutter, Michael (1981). "Stress, Coping and Development: Some Issues and Some Questions". Journal of Child Psychology and Psychiatry. 22 (4): 323–356. doi:10.1111/j.1469-7610.1981.tb00560.x. ISSN 0021-9630. 
  9. ^ Kagan, Jerome (1982). "The Emergence of Self". Journal of Child Psychology and Psychiatry. 23 (4): 363–381. doi:10.1111/j.1469-7610.1982.tb00084.x. ISSN 0021-9630. 
  10. ^ Venables, PH (1989). "The Emanuel Miller memorial lecture 1987. Childhood markers for adult disorders". J Child Psychol Psychiatry. 30 (3): 347–64. doi:10.1111/j.1469-7610.1989.tb00251.x. PMID 2663899. 
  11. ^ Bennett, Neville (1991). "The Emanuel Miller Memorial Lecture 1990 Cooperative Learning in Classrooms: Processes and Outcomes". Journal of Child Psychology and Psychiatry. 32 (4): 581–594. doi:10.1111/j.1469-7610.1991.tb00336.x. ISSN 0021-9630. 
  12. ^ Gillberg, Christopher; Coleman, Mary (2000-01-18). The Biology of the Autistic Syndromes. Cambridge University Press. p. 77. ISBN 9781898683223. Retrieved 28 July 2017. 
  13. ^ Fonagy, P; Steele, M; Steele, H; Higgitt, A; Target, M (1994). "The Emanuel Miller Memorial Lecture 1992. The theory and practice of resilience". J Child Psychol Psychiatry. 35 (2): 231–57. doi:10.1111/j.1469-7610.1994.tb01160.x. PMID 8188797. 
  14. ^ Plomin, R (1994). "The Emanuel Miller Memorial Lecture 1993. Genetic research and identification of environmental influences". J Child Psychol Psychiatry. 35 (5): 817–34. doi:10.1111/j.1469-7610.1994.tb02297.x. PMID 7962243. 
  15. ^ Kovacs, M. (1997). "The Emanuel Miller Memorial Lecture 1994. Depressive disorders in childhood: an impressionistic landscape". J Child Psychol Psychiatry. 38 (3): 287–98. doi:10.1111/j.1469-7610.1997.tb01513.x. PMID 9232475. 
  16. ^ Dunn, J (1996). "The Emanuel Miller Memorial Lecture 1995. Children's relationships: bridging the divide between cognitive and social development". J Child Psychol Psychiatry. 37 (5): 507–18. doi:10.1111/j.1469-7610.1996.tb01437.x. PMID 8807431. 
  17. ^ Mcmahon, Linnet; Ward, Adrian (2014-04-08). Intuition is Not Enough: Matching Learning with Practice in Therapeutic Child Care. Routledge. p. 241. ISBN 9781317798651. Retrieved 4 October 2017. 
  18. ^ Sigman, M. (1998). "The Emanuel Miller Memorial Lecture 1997. Change and continuity in the development of children with autism". J Child Psychol Psychiatry. 39 (6): 817–27. doi:10.1111/1469-7610.00383. PMID 9758191. 
  19. ^ Rutter, M (1999). "Autism: Two-way Interplay between Research and Clinical Work". The Journal of Child Psychology and Psychiatry, and Allied Disciplines. 40: 169–188. doi:10.1017/s0021963098003461. 
  20. ^ Yule, William (2000). "Emanuel Miller Lecture From Pogroms to "Ethnic Cleansing": Meeting the Needs of War Affected Children". Journal of Child Psychology and Psychiatry. 41 (6): 695–702. doi:10.1111/1469-7610.00657. ISSN 0021-9630. 
  21. ^ Belsky, Jay (2001). "Emanuel Miller Lecture Developmental Risks (Still) Associated with Early Child Care". Journal of Child Psychology and Psychiatry. 42 (7): 845–859. doi:10.1111/1469-7610.00782. ISSN 0021-9630. 
  22. ^ Frith, Uta (2004). "Emanuel Miller lecture: Confusions and controversies about Asperger syndrome". Journal of Child Psychology and Psychiatry. 45 (4): 672–686. doi:10.1111/j.1469-7610.2004.00262.x. ISSN 0021-9630. 
  23. ^ "ERIC - The Emanuel Miller Memorial Lecture 2006: Adoption as Intervention. Meta-Analytic Evidence for Massive Catch-Up and Plasticity in Physical, Socio-Emotional, and Cognitive Development, Journal of Child Psychology and Psychiatry, 2006-Dec". United States Department of Education. Retrieved 4 October 2017. 
  24. ^ Goodyer, Ian M. (2008). "Emanuel Miller Lecture: Early onset depressions - meanings, mechanisms and processes". Journal of Child Psychology and Psychiatry. 49 (12): 1239–1256. doi:10.1111/J.1469-7610.2008.01964.X. ISSN 0021-9630. 
  25. ^ Rutter, Michael; Jana Kreppner; Edmund Sonuga-Barke (2009). "Emanuel Miller Lecture: Attachment insecurity, disinhibited attachment, and attachment disorders: where do research findings leave the concepts?". Journal of Child Psychology and Psychiatry. 50 (5): 529–543. doi:10.1111/j.1469-7610.2009.02042.x. ISSN 0021-9630. 
  26. ^ Bishop, D. V. M. (2013). "Research Review: Emanuel Miller Memorial Lecture 2012 - Neuroscientific studies of intervention for language impairment in children: interpretive and methodological problems". Journal of Child Psychology and Psychiatry. 54 (3): 247–259. doi:10.1111/jcpp.12034. ISSN 0021-9630. PMC 3593170 . 
  27. ^ "Emanuel Miller Memorial Lecture and Conference 2018 - ACAMH". Retrieved 4 October 2017.
